result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel L. Everson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Daniel L. Everson in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Daniel L. Everson in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances.  Atty McL speaks to the court about his motion to withdraw. Defendant speaks to the court. Motion to withdraw is denied.   No additions or corrections to the PSI. State speaks to the court. Atty McL speaks to the court.

Sentencing--
2 years probation--ADOA Assessment, Must obtain employment. Obtain GED.  Absolute Sobriety.  No contact w/ Matthew Stone. Not to consume any alcohol. Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed doctor. 54 days jail 54 days credit.  DNA Sample + Costs

State's Discovery Response

8:40 am  Defendant, Daniel L. Everson appeared with Attorney Andrew S. Lawton.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances. 15CF56   Ms. Winton calls Officer Tyler Walsh.  Clerk swears witness.  Court takes judicial notice of bond, at the request of Ms. Winton.  Ms. Winton questions Officer Walsh, who describes incident and parties.  Court finds that officer has identified the defendant.  Mr. Lawton questions Officer Walsh.  Ms. WInton asks for bind over.  Court finds and binds over.  Information given to court.  Defendant has received information.  Waive reading.  Not guilty plea.

15CF64  Ms. Winton calls Officer  Derrick Ricci.   Clerk swears in the officer.  Ms. Winton asks the court to note bail bond on 15CF56.  Court so notes.  Ms. Winton questions Officer Ricci.  Officer identifies the defendant.  Court so finds identification.  Mr. Lawton questions witness.  Objection by Ms. Winton.  Sustained.  No defense witnesses.  Mr. Lawton gives argument.  Ms. Winton addresses jurisdiction issue.  Court finds probable cause; reserves jurisdiction issue for later.  Bound over.  Information given to Court and to defendant.  Waive reading.  No guilty plea entered.  Substitution until June 26th.  Defense motions by July 10th.  Status/motions  July 15 at 1:00 pm.  Mr. Lawton notes defendant has a job logging.  Curfew request for work purposes only.  Ms. Winton objects.  Court denies request.  Submission of DNA ordered forthwith.

Ricci sworn & testifies on 15 CF 57; Atty Lawton - cross; ADA Winton - nothing; witness excused; Atty Lawton - no witnesses; ADA Winton tenders Information - Atty Lawton waives reading; deft plead NG - court so enters NG on both cases.  Atty Lawton made request for bail modification - court denies.  Bail cont.  Adj'd 8:55 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
